snippet: Playing for a tie may go against the grain of many American sports, but it can be a good way to invest. After all, modern finance theory tells us that we don’t need to beat the market.
abstract: Jeff Sommer Strategies column contends that playing for a tie may go against the grain of many American sports, but it can be a good way to invest; points out that modern finance theory says investors do not need to beat the market, but only to tie--or match--the market return.
lead_paragraph: Playing for a tie may go against the grain of many American sports, but it can be a good way to invest. After all, modern finance theory tells us that we don’t need to beat the market.

headline.print_headline: In Investing, No Need For Sudden Death
headline.seo: In Investing, at Least, It Makes Sense to Play for a Tie
headline.main: In Investing, No Need for Sudden Death
